title: Bachelor in Paradise star Alex Nation won't do reality TV dating again
text:
She failed to find lasting love on reality TV, despite winning the heart of Richie Strahan on The Bachelor, and then Bill Goldsmith on Bachelor in Paradise.

And on Friday, Alex Nation revealed that she's done with trying to find love of reality TV, and instead wants to focus on putting herself first.

'I'm putting myself first for a change,' Alex told the Herald Sun.

No more reality dating! Alex Nation (pictured) revealed that she's done with trying to find love of reality TV, and instead wants to focus on putting herself first

'I felt like I bounced from relationship to relationship and I didn't help my cause. I won't be doing a dating show again.'

After separating from Richie, Alex then became engaged to her AFL women’s football teammate Maegan Luxa, however, they also split up.

Despite their short-lived romance, Alex took to Instagram earlier this year to pay tribute to her ex-fiancée for helping her explore her sexuality.

Unlucky at love! Alex (left) failed to find lasting love on reality TV, despite winning the heart of Richie Strahan (right) on The Bachelor

Hopeless romantic! Moving on from Richie, Alex (left) found short-lived love with Bill Goldsmith (right) on Bachelor in Paradise

The Melbourne mother-of-one shared several loved-up snaps of herself and Megan in May, to honour International Day Against Homophobia, Transphobia and Biphobia.

'You gave me a safe place to discover and understand who I am. You were there when it all made sense and you were there when none of it did,' she wrote.

The former reality star, who previously set the record straight on her sexuality, saying she doesn't want to be 'labelled' as bisexual, is shifting her focus to work instead.

No labels! Alex (pictured) has previously set the record straight on her sexuality, saying she doesn't want to be 'labelled' as bisexual

Moving on! Alex (right) said despite winning the heart of Richie (left) on The bachelor, she's done with reality dating shows

Aside from teaching kids how to play footy with the introductory program Next Gen Minis, Alex is also trying her hand at podcasting and is set to launch her own show.

According to the publication, the soon-to-be developed podcast will have a strong focus on women, relationships and motherhood.

In addition to lending her voice to the show, the 28-year-old will showcase the latest Spring Racing looks alongside Neighbours star Sharon Johal at an event on Sunday.

The pair will run through what's likely to trend on the fashion fields this season at the Brunch Affairs event, which is being held at the Prince Dining Room in St Kilda.
description: She failed to find lasting love on reality TV, despite winning the heart of Richie Strahan on The Bachelor, and then Bill Goldsmith on Bachelor in Paradise.
authors: Mark Brook For Daily Mail Australia
